A lot of twists and deaths. I feel like: After Force Awakens and Rogue One\, this movie was just really\, really disappointing!  Way too much comic relief (sometimes seemed more like Guardians of the Galaxy)\, non-sensical sequences\, \"Force\" powers that border on ridiculous - or at least inconsistent with previous examples.  Also seemed very political - rich vs poor\, animal rights\, weapons suppliers fanning the flames of war\, role of women in leadership\, etc. which is all well and good - but that is not what Star Wars has been so much about in the past\, in my opinion\, and it just ruins a good movie.  And many fans seem to have spent more time concocting reasonable character connects than this director (Rian Johnson?).  Went to the opening night showing - no one clapped or cheered at the end as is typical for midnight showing!  We represented the faithful Star Wars fan base and I think everyone was just in shock about how bad this movie was...and it could have been so great!!  Frustrated and disappointed.
